title: Us Companies Warn Of Multibillion Dollar Setbacks Amid Trade War
content: HS SportsReinhardt’s Insurance Player of the Game-BasketballLock Stock & Barrel Sub of the Game-BasketballPigskin Pick’emReinhardt’s Insurance Player of the GameLock Stock & Barrel Play of the Game-Football Reinhardt’s Insurance Player of the Game-Basketball Lock Stock & Barrel Sub of the Game-Basketball Pigskin Pick’em Reinhardt’s Insurance Player of the Game Lock Stock & Barrel Play of the Game-Football Reinhardt’s Insurance Player of the Game-Basketball Lock Stock & Barrel Sub of the Game-Basketball Pigskin Pick’em Reinhardt’s Insurance Player of the Game Lock Stock & Barrel Play of the Game-Football Syndicated Shows Local Shows Contests The Boom Boom Room with your host Ray Mancini Sweet Deals Advertising **US Companies Warn of Multibillion-Dollar Setbacks Amid Trade War** American companies are voicing concern over the escalating tariffs issued by the Trump administration to China. The Hill reported that American companies are warning of multibillion-dollar losses and deep uncertainty. United Airlines issued two separate financial outlooks, citing the unpredictable nature of the current economic climate. The company said it was “impossible to predict” whether the U.S. could slide into a recession as a result of the ongoing reciprocal tariffs. Johnson & Johnson CEO Joaquin Duato voiced his concern over the potential for new tariffs on pharmaceuticals, warning that such measures could disrupt the medical supply chain.
